name: Writing About Music
description: This course will consider what makes for an effective piece of critical or creative writing about music by looking at a wide range of essays, stories and poems that celebrate, theorize, or attempt to translate the impact of classical, jazz and popular musical performances. Authors studied will include Ross, Murakami, Byrne, Cather, Nabokov, Baldwin, Ishiguro and others. Restricted to first-year students. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
